Class GameScreen

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
game.ui.GameScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class GameScreen extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
Main game screen that manages the game loop, UI coordination, and user input. Central controller for the Cookie Run-inspired endless runner game.

Architecture - Manager Pattern:

  • AudioManager - All sound and music management with proper MediaPlayer lifecycle
  • ThemeRenderer - Theme cycling, transitions, parallax backgrounds with 4 layers
  • SpawnManager - Entity spawning logic with probability-based distribution
  • CollisionManager - Collision detection and response with audio feedback
  • HUDRenderer - All UI/HUD rendering (score, health, speed boost, overlays)

Responsibilities:

  • Game loop coordination (AnimationTimer with delta time)
  • State management (MENU, PLAYING, PAUSED, GAME_OVER)
  • Entity lifecycle management (lists of obstacles, items, platforms)
  • UI/Button management (6 buttons with hover effects)
  • Input handling (keyboard controls for jump/slide)
  • Manager coordination and delegation

Features:

  • Dynamic theme cycling (Morning → Sunset → Midnight) every 30 seconds
  • Smooth 2-second fade transitions between themes
  • 4-layer parallax scrolling (background, cloud, mountain, grass)
  • Speed boost mechanic (2.0x speed for 3 seconds)
  • Smooth health bar animation with rainbow gradient
  • Pause/Resume functionality with music control
  • Game over delay (0.5s) for smooth health depletion animation
  • Passive health decay (2 HP/second)
  • Passive score gain (10 points/second)

  • Constructor Details

    • GameScreen

      public GameScreen()
      Constructs the GameScreen and initializes all components. Sets up canvas, loads resources, creates buttons, and prepares the game world.

  • Method Details

    • configureImageView

      private void configureImageView(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, double width, double height)
      Configures an ImageView with standard dimensions and aspect ratio.
      Parameters:
      imageView - the ImageView to configure
      width - the desired width
      height - the desired height

    • setupButtonHoverEffect

      private void setupButtonHoverEffect(javafx.scene.control.Button button, javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView)
      Sets up hover effects for a button (scale and opacity changes).
      Parameters:
      button - the button to set up
      imageView - the button's ImageView graphic

    • initInput

      private void initInput()
      Initializes keyboard input handlers for player controls. Sets up key press/release handlers for jumping (SPACE/UP) and sliding (DOWN).

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the main game loop using JavaFX AnimationTimer. The loop runs continuously and calls update() and render() each frame.

    • update

      private void update(double dt)
      Updates all game logic based on elapsed time. Handles physics, collisions, spawning, theme cycling, and game state.
      Parameters:
      dt - delta time in seconds since last update

    • resetGame

      private void resetGame(boolean instantlyStart)
      Resets the game to initial state. Clears all entities, resets score, and optionally starts gameplay immediately.
      Parameters:
      instantlyStart - if true, starts playing immediately; if false, returns to menu

    • render

      private void render()
      Renders all visual elements to the canvas. Draws backgrounds, entities, HUD, and menu screens based on game state.

    • updateEntities

      private void updateEntities(double scrollDt)
      Updates all entities (obstacles, items, platforms) with scrolling.
      Parameters:
      scrollDt - Delta time adjusted by scroll speed
